p: Presentation of symptoms for COVID-19 infection can be seen 2â€“14 days after exposure. These symptoms include fever, cough, and difficult breathing ( 4, 5). A severe complication of this disease is progressive respiratory failure, and death may occur in 6.4% of the cases ( 3, 6, 7). The potential impact of SARS-CoV-2 on the kidneys is still undetermined, but emerging evidence indicates that kidney complications are frequent, and COVID-19 disease may have unique features in individuals on chronic dialysis and kidney transplant recipients ( 8).
